metadata.title: CVE-2018-12401 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
Some special resource URIs will cause a non-exploitable crash if loadedwith optional parameters following a '?' in the parsed string. This couldlead to denial of service (DOS) attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 63.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
